title: feature-request: Ask a second relay for the payload, if the winner relay did not provide payload in time
body:
Previously, there has been several times when a mev relay who won the bid but did not provide the payload in time (either connection issue or a service issue), resulting in missed proposals and loss of money.

In future, is it possible that we could ask a second relay for the payload as a backup simultaneously? Or ask in sequence when the first relay fails to respond and then ask a second best bid?

Hey @biteric2000 that's a great suggestion, but unfortunately it's not possible. At this particular moment, you have submitted a `SignedBlindedBeaconBlock` to the relay and would be at risk of being slashed if you proposed a different block as a fallback. The relay could gossip the block you sent it and you would be slashed for making two proposals.

According to the [builder-specs](https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/blob/main/specs/validator.md#proposer-slashing):

> This means if a validator publishes a signature for a `BlindedBeaconBlock` (via a dissemination of a `SignedBlindedBeaconBlock`) then the validator **MUST** not use the local build process as a fallback, even in the event of some failure with the external builder network.

In your examples, both of the missing payloads came from the Eden relay. I suggest reaching out to them.

Thank you @jtraglia for your helpful comment and explanation.
The above logs are just examples. Actually we just missed one proposal with relaywooor yesterday, with a reward tip of 0.08 ETH lost (excluding execution reward). Previously we also tried to contact the relay service providers through channels like discord, but with little feedback / solution.
Anyway, looking forward to any possible means towards solving the similar problems in future!
